hills.Name: Manali, Himachal Pradesh
hills.Description: Manali, in Himachal Pradesh, is a stunning hill station nestled in the Kullu Valley, known for its snow-capped mountains, lush green valleys, and adventure activities like skiing, trekking, and paragliding. It is also famous for the Solang Valley, Rohtang Pass, and Hidimba Temple, making it a favorite destination for honeymooners and thrill-seekers.

hills.Name: Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu
hills.Description: Kodaikanal, often called the 'Princess of Hill Stations,' is a serene retreat in Tamil Nadu, surrounded by misty mountains and lush greenery. Known for its star-shaped Kodaikanal Lake, Coaker's Walk, and Silver Cascade Falls, it offers a tranquil escape with breathtaking views, cool weather, and vibrant flora.

hills.Name: Ooty, Tamil Nadu
hills.Description: Ooty, the 'Queen of Hill Stations,' lies in the Nilgiri Hills and is famous for its tea plantations, botanical gardens, and the UNESCO-listed Nilgiri Mountain Railway. Major attractions include Ooty Lake, Doddabetta Peak, and the enchanting Rose Garden, making it a perfect getaway for nature enthusiasts and families.

hills.Name: Coorg (Kodagu), Karnataka
hills.Description: Coorg, known as the 'Scotland of India,' is a picturesque hill station in Karnataka, offering lush coffee plantations, misty hills, and serene waterfalls. Popular spots include Abbey Falls, Raja's Seat, and Dubare Elephant Camp. It’s also a hub for trekking, birdwatching, and experiencing the region’s rich culture.

hills.Name: Munnar, Kerala
hills.Description: Munnar, located in the Western Ghats of Kerala, is renowned for its rolling tea gardens, mist-covered hills, and pristine beauty. It is home to the Eravikulam National Park, Mattupetty Dam, and Anamudi Peak. The cool climate and panoramic views make it a favorite among honeymooners and nature lovers.

beaches.Name: Pondicherry
beaches.Description: Pondicherry offers serene beaches like Paradise Beach and Rock Beach, blending French colonial charm with a laid-back seaside vibe.

beaches.Name: Goa
beaches.Description: Goa is India's beach paradise, famous for its lively nightlife, golden sands, and water sports. Popular beaches include Baga, Calangute, and Palolem.

beaches.Name: Marina Beach, Tamil Nadu
beaches.Description: Located in Chennai, Marina Beach is one of the longest urban beaches in the world, offering stunning sunrises and a lively atmosphere.

beaches.Name: Lakshadweep
beaches.Description: Lakshadweep's pristine islands boast crystal-clear waters, coral reefs, and serene beaches, making it a tropical paradise for water lovers.

beaches.Name: Kovalam, Kerala
beaches.Description: Kovalam is renowned for its crescent-shaped beaches, lighthouse views, and calm waters perfect for swimming and relaxation.

temples.Name: Brihadeeswara Temple, Tamil Nadu
temples.Description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this ancient Chola temple is an architectural marvel dedicated to Lord Shiva.

temples.Name: Sun Temple, Odisha
temples.Description: The Sun Temple at Konark is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, famed for its intricate carvings and chariot-like structure dedicated to the Sun God.

temples.Name: Madurai Meenakshi Amman Temple, Tamil Nadu
temples.Description: This iconic Dravidian-style temple is known for its vibrant sculptures and is dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi and Lord Sundareswarar.

temples.Name: Golden Temple, Punjab
temples.Description: The Golden Temple in Amritsar is a spiritual haven, renowned for its stunning gold-plated architecture and the serene Amrit Sarovar.

culture.Name: Taj Mahal, Uttar Pradesh
culture.Description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Taj Mahal is an iconic symbol of love and one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

culture.Name: Gateway of India, Maharashtra
culture.Description: Located in Mumbai, the Gateway of India is a historic monument overlooking the Arabian Sea, representing India's colonial past.

culture.Name: Ajanta and Ellora Caves, Maharashtra
culture.Description: These UNESCO World Heritage Sites are famous for their ancient Buddhist rock-cut caves, intricate carvings, and stunning frescoes.

culture.Name: Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu
culture.Description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Mahabalipuram is known for its rock-cut temples, including the Shore Temple, showcasing Pallava architecture.

culture.Name: Auroville, Tamil Nadu
culture.Description: Auroville is an experimental township promoting unity and peace, featuring the iconic Matrimandir and tranquil surroundings.
